result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ryan T. Braker not in Court.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 15CF405 and 14CF441. Hearing was held on March 5th where defendant was found in contempt for not filing the financial statement. Defendant did file the financial statement in March. Court reviewed that statement. State requested a warrant. Warrant authorized forthwith. 3:40/3:44.

records.addlTxt: to defendant re: payment of atty fees.
Petition and Order for Payment of Fees in case nos:  14 CF 291, 14 CF 441, & 15 CF 405 per statement submitted by Atty Sarbacker
Restitution Stipulation in the probation amount of $4517.63 plus surcharge for a total of $4969.39.
Filed by ADA Crystal Long

Defendant Ryan T. Braker in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CF291, 15CF405, and 14CF441.  Rights/Elements.  In 14CF441 defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  14CF291 Dismissed.  15CF405 Dismissed but read in for restitution.  In 14CF441 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include: $518.00 costs to be paid in first year.  Submit DNA sample.  Restitution $10845.18 and in 15CF405 Restitution $4969.39.  Defendant is to pay $750.00 per month in restitution.  If paid in full after 1 year, defendant may discharge early from probation.  May not bid or take on any jobs on his own.  Must report by 1 pm today to probation.  No jail credit.
Defendant may leave the State of Wis. on 8/19/16 to attend a wedding in Michigan and return to Wis. on 8-21-16
